reviews.text: Heard this was one of the most popular Apfelwine places in Frankfurt so we tried it out. Started off ordering 2 glasses of Apfelwine. Interesting taste and not too bad. Then we moved on to ordering food. We ordered the Schnitzel with Frankfurt Green Sauce and potatoes. We also ordered the Pork rib cooked with sauerkraut and potatoes.  The pork rib had really nice flavor as well as the sauerkraut. Still thinking about it! Overall the food was solid, the employees were attentive and it was a nice experience.

Extremely overrated. Staff was rude and whistled to ask for tips despite poor service.
Food was so-so. The apple wine was just fair as I have tried much better ones in other restaurant. I wonder why it still got >4 stars in the overall rating. Would not recommend others to visit this restaurant.

Perfecttt
We came here for our lunch and had pork knuckle and rib with apple wine. They are all scrumptious. The best is pork knuckle, I’m sure you must try it. The staff are so friendly. The restaurant is spacious which can fit any sizes of group.
Nothing to complain!!!

We tried all the vegetarian dishes and appetizers plus one dish with meat.

The so-called handkäse, aka German sour milk cheese, is surprisingly tasty, yet the bread accompanying it was dry and flavorless.
The Spundekäs, cream cheese seasoned with different spices and served with the pretzel, was delicious, as were the vegan sausages with the potatoes (Vegane Bratwurst), The red cabbage (Rotkraut), and the Gemüserösti mit Quark.

The meat-based dish, Haxe mit Bratkartoffeln was super flavorsome.

Finally the green sauce of Frankfurt was tasty as well but the eggs were overcooked and low quality.
The service is quick, and the restaurant is packed. It is better to show up early to avoid queuing.
Very cozy and crowded on cold weekday night. It’s all about sharing tables here. I’m not super impressed with the green sauce after all the hype. Good but for me, not great.
